ratings.note: CROSSOVER credit (Ba1/BB) - one notch below investment grade. Withdrawn rating on 2026 notes.

overview.business_description: Automotive supplier developing comfort, driving assistance, powertrain, and thermal systems for vehicles. Products serve OEMs and independent aftermarket globally. Major Tier 1 supplier with exposure to EV transition.
overview.fatal_flaw: AUTOMOTIVE SECTOR HEADWINDS. FCF weak due to high capex and cash interest. Cut FY25 sales guidance to EUR 20.5bn (Jul 2025). Distress score 19 despite low leverage. Mar 2026 maturity ($659m) approaching. EV transition uncertainty. Net income declining ($246m→$147m). 2028 notes trading below par (95.37) due to low coupon.
overview.ownership: Public - Euronext Paris (FR). Major shareholders: Norges Bank, Capital World Investors, Vanguard, Dimensional.
overview.recent_news: FCF to remain weak amid automotive sector weakness, high capex and cash interest costs (Aug 2025 credit report). Cut FY25 sales guidance to EUR 20.5bn (Jul 2025). 1H25 EBITDA rises by 6% YoY to $1.47bn (Jul 2025). Priced EUR 500m senior unsecured 2032 note at 4.625% (Sep 2025). Completed divestiture of powertrain division to Shanghai Sinotec (Jul 2025).

quick_assessment.note: LOW LEVERAGE despite auto sector challenges. Near-IG credit.

key_ratios.note: Very low leverage for HY credit. Valuation compressed due to auto sector concerns.

trend_analysis.trend_summary: STABLE leverage profile. EBITDA improving slightly. Margins expanding (8.7%→9.5%). But net income DECLINING and FCF weak after capex. Revenue volatile with auto cycle.

maturity_schedule.note: Mar 2026 maturity ($659m) near-term focus. Well-laddered otherwise.

recent_transactions.note: Active portfolio management - divesting non-core to focus and delever

credit_opinion.summary: Valeo is a CROSSOVER credit (Ba1/BB) with LOW LEVERAGE of only 1.8x net despite automotive sector headwinds. Most bonds trade above par (100-107) with IG-tight yields (3-4.5%). The company generates strong EBITDA ($2.35bn) and CFFO ($2.95bn). However, the auto sector faces structural challenges (EV transition, OEM pricing pressure), FCF is weak after high capex, and net income is declining. Cut FY25 sales guidance in Jul 2025. Mar 2026 maturity ($659m) needs refinancing. Active portfolio management through divestitures is positive. Distress score of 19 is elevated for a credit with such low leverage - reflects sector concerns rather than balance sheet issues.

distress_indicators.trading_signals: Most bonds at 100-107 (above par). Yields 3-4.5% are IG-tight for Ba1/BB credit. 2028 notes at 95 (below par) due to 1% coupon - technical not fundamental. LOW LEVERAGE (1.8x) belies distress score of 19 - sector concern, not balance sheet.

sector_analysis.peer_comparison: Better leverage than most auto suppliers. Forvia more levered.
